MAP goal: 65 mmHg or greater, Sodium goal: 140 to 150 mmol/L, pH goal: 7.3 to 7.45, SpO2 goal: 92% or greater, Temperature target 36 to 38 DegC
If urine output greater than 250 mL/h for 2 consecutive hours
q4h, if patient expresses pain, use Numeric Rating Scale (goal less than 4). If patient exhibits signs of pain, use Behavioural Pain Scale (goal less than 6)
Insert 2 large bore IV's unless already in place

All patients in ICU are considered moderate or high risk for VTE; order anticoagulant prophylaxis unless contraindicated. Intracerebral hemorrhage and subarachnoid hemorrhage are high risk for bleeding. Sequential compression devices recommended as DVT prophylaxis until approved by critical care, neurology or neurosurgery

RASS goal of 0, Alert and Calm
RASS goal of -1, Drowsy, sustained eye opening and eye contact for more than 10 seconds to voice
RASS goal of -2, Light sedation, eye opening and eye contact for less than 10 seconds to voice
RASS goal of -3, Moderate sedation, movement but no eye contact to voice
RASS goal of -4, Deep sedation, no response to voice, only rousable to pain
